dict.acceptation: （地方）易受攻击的；易受伤的；易受批评的；[桥牌]已成局的；

sent.orig: But in today's economy, educated, white-collar workers also are vulnerable to downsizing.
sent.trans: 但是，在今天的经济中，受过教育的白领工人也同样容易受到裁员的攻击。

sent.orig: They are more vulnerable to sexual abuse, inappropriate sexual behaviour, sexually transmitted diseases and teenage pregnancy.
sent.trans: 他们更容易受到性虐待，不恰当性行为，传播性疾病以及青少年怀孕的伤害。

sent.orig: The railway is vulnerable to the same process.
sent.trans: 同样，铁路也会受到这种过程的影响。

sent.orig: Everyone must be on guard against scams, but seniors can sometimes be vulnerable to fraud.
sent.trans: 每个人都应该对诈骗提高警觉﹐但是老年人有时候特别容易上当受骗。

sent.orig: Share best practice in diabetes education, prevention and care that targets disadvantaged and vulnerable groups.
sent.trans: 与糖尿病弱势群体分享最好的教育、预防和治疗手段。
